docs.snippet: The history of a duo working for a Singaporean match-fixing syndicate reveals how pervasively illicit gambling operations have infected global soccer....
docs.lead_paragraph: The history of a duo working for a Singaporean match-fixing syndicate reveals how pervasively illicit gambling operations have infected global soccer.
docs.abstract: Testimony of Wilson Raj Perumal, Singaporean match-fixer arrested in Finland, reveals how pervasively illicit gambling operations have infected global soccer; Perumal's account details how his syndicate manipulated hundreds of professional soccer matches around the world, including World Cup exhibition matches in 2010, by identifying players and referees who were ripe for bribery (Series: Rigged).

headline.main: Inside the Fixing: How a Gang Battered Soccer’s Frail Integrity
headline.print_headline: Inside the Fixing: How a Gang Battered Soccer’s Frail Integrity

docs.snippet: The organizers denied charges of wrongdoing after a British newspaper reported that a former FIFA vice president paid top soccer officials to build support for Qatar’s bid....
docs.lead_paragraph: The organizers denied charges of wrongdoing after a British newspaper reported that a former FIFA vice president paid top soccer officials to build support for Qatar’s bid.
docs.abstract: Organizers of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar deny allegations of wrongdoing in response to report in Sunday Times of London accusing former FIFA vice president Mohamed bin Hammam of bribing top soccer officials to build support for Qatar's bid.

headline.main: World Cup Corruption Accusation Is Disputed
headline.print_headline: World Cup Corruption Accusation Is Disputed

docs.snippet: The fate of the 2022 football World Cup could be decided within weeks after the man leading the internal investigation into how Qatar won the right to host it announced on Monday he would complete his probe next week and report back in July....
docs.lead_paragraph: The fate of the 2022 football World Cup could be decided within weeks after the man leading the internal investigation into how Qatar won the right to host it announced on Monday he would complete his probe next week and report back in July.

headline.main: FIFA Investigation Into Qatar 2022 to Report Within Weeks
headline.print_headline: FIFA Investigation Into Qatar 2022 to Report Within Weeks

docs.snippet: Issa Hayatou, head of the African Football Confederation (CAF) and vice-president of FIFA, has "categorically" denied allegations in Britain's Sunday Times newspaper that he received gifts and money to support Qatar's bid for the 2022 World Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: Issa Hayatou, head of the African Football Confederation (CAF) and vice-president of FIFA, has "categorically" denied allegations in Britain's Sunday Times newspaper that he received gifts and money to support Qatar's bid for the 2022 World Cup.

headline.main: CAF Boss Hayatou Slams 'Smear Campaign' Over Qatar Bid
headline.print_headline: CAF Boss Hayatou Slams 'Smear Campaign' Over Qatar Bid

docs.snippet: Secret slush funds, junkets, gifts and payments to football officials. At first glance, the latest allegations that a Qatari official greased palms to help buy the 2022 World Cup for his Gulf nation make very depressing reading for anyone who love...
docs.lead_paragraph: Secret slush funds, junkets, gifts and payments to football officials. At first glance, the latest allegations that a Qatari official greased palms to help buy the 2022 World Cup for his Gulf nation make very depressing reading for anyone who loves the global game and its showcase tournament.

headline.main: Column: No Need for Rush to Judgment on Qatar
headline.print_headline: Column: No Need for Rush to Judgment on Qatar

docs.snippet: Former Manchester United captain and current Ireland assistant manager Roy Keane has pulled out of the running for the vacant coaching position at Scottish champions Celtic, the Football Association of Ireland said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Manchester United captain and current Ireland assistant manager Roy Keane has pulled out of the running for the vacant coaching position at Scottish champions Celtic, the Football Association of Ireland said on Monday.
